Iz najbolj nogometne vasi v Sloveniji v Savdsko Arabijo
Slovenski strokovnjak Klemen Gradišar več kot eno leto dela v Džidi, skrbi tudi za šolanje nogometnih trenerjev.
03 Nov 2019, 20:05 by Drago Perko



Klemen Gradišar in princ Abdul Aziz, minister za šport FOTOGRAFIJE: OSEBNIH ARHIV



Na enem od predavanj domačim trenerjem



Prisluhnil je tudi Joseju Mourinhu.



Klemen Gradišar že več kot eno leto deluje v Savdski Arabiji. FOTO: C.GAVELLE/PSG


Verjetno ni države na tem ljubem svetu, v kateri si marljiva in iznajdljiva slovenska duša ne bi služila cekinov. Tudi v Savdski Arabiji je nekaj naših ljudi našlo svojo poslovno priložnost. Med njimi je 35-letni Klemen Gradišar iz Naklega, ki več kot eno leto vodi nogometno akademijo slovitega francoskega giganta PSG! Začelo se je na Gorenjskem. »Športu sem se zapisal hitro, štiri leta sem bil star, ko sem začel v NK Naklo, kjer je delovala moja celotna družina. Rad se spomnim zlatih dni NK Naklo, ko smo bili ob Beltincih najbolj nogometna vas v Sloveniji. Tam sem igral, bil pobiralec žog, potem pa igral še za Savo, Šenčur, a sem hitro končal igralsko kariero in se lotil trenerstva. Sprva v NK Naklo, potem sedem let v SAK Celovec, bil sem tudi v NK Šenčur, kot zunanji sodelavec še v NK Triglav,« pove o svojih nogometnih začetkih.
Prejšnji mesec je bil na tem koncu sveta izjemni trener Jose Mourinho, z veseljem mu je prisluhnil tudi Klemen.
Niso pozabili na življenjepis


Na enem od predavanj domačim trenerjem

Vmes je spoznal Primorca Sandija Sejdinovskega, ki je vodil PSG-jevo akademijo v Egiptu. Klemnu je nekajkrat omenil, da bo nehal delati v Egiptu in naj mu pošlje svoj življenjepis. Rečeno, storjeno, a iz Egipta se niso javili. »Potem je prišel klic iz Savdske Arabije, kjer pa je lastnik licence za PSG-jevo akademijo Egipčan. Ta je poznal ljudi iz akademije v Egiptu, kjer so me priporočili. Vprašali so me, ali bi prišel v Džido (Jeddah) in začel delati,« razkrije Gradišar, ki se ni dal dvakrat prositi. Danes 35-letni Gorenjec je tehnični direktor PSG-jeve akademije, njegov rojak Narsej Mubi, tudi slovenski trener, pa je poskrbel za delo na terenu.»Najprej hvala Sandiju, ker mi je pomagal, hvala tudi sodelavcu Narseju za narejeno v PSG. Nanj se lahko vedno zanesem, svoje delo je opravil izjemno. Skupaj sva zmogla tudi skozi težke trenutke,« pohvali sodelavca, s katerim sta uredila in vzpostavila razmere za delo in razvoj akademije na tem koncu sveta ob Rdečem morju. Klemen se je hitro navadil na vreme (pričakale so ga visoke temperature in vlaga, danes se segreje do 33 stopinj), drugo kulturo in običaje. Jasno mu je, da se tam petkrat na dan moli, takrat se ustavi vse, na prvem mestu je molitev.35 centov za bencinKlemen pove, da so trgovine še bolje založene kot v Sloveniji, kamor se vrača na nekaj mesecev. Svoje izpostave v Savdski Arabiji imajo vse multinacionalke s hitro prehrano; cene so primerljive s slovenskimi, le liter bencina stane okoli 35 centov.
Dežela priložnosti
Uredili so mu veliko novo prostorno stanovanje s pogledom na Rdeče morje. Imel je urejen prevoz, za volan je sedel tudi sam. »Kolikor je narodov v mestu, toliko je različnih pravil in tolmačenj. Ob takem prometu na štiripasovnicah se človek navadi potrpežljivosti. Tu je praksa, da si v primeru blagega trka, odrgnine ali udrtine šoferja le pomahata in gresta vsak svojo pot,« opiše Klemen, ki pravi, da se Savdska Arabija odpira tudi turistom, in izpostavi predvsem koralne grebene na severu Rdečega morja. »Savdska Arabija je dežela priložnosti. Tudi za Slovenijo in Slovence,« meni Klemen, ki poleg vodenja akademije skrbi za šolanje in izobraževanje trenerjev. »Nogomet je v državi šport številka ena. Prepričan sem, da bodo v nekaj letih ob aktivaciji vseh resursov, ki so še ostali, igrali pomembno vlogo tudi na velikih tekmovanjih,« je prepričan.

From the most football village in Slovenia to Saudi Arabia
Slovenian expert Klemen Gradišar has been working in Jeddah for over a year and is also in charge of training football coaches.
03 Nov 2019, 19:05 by Drago Perko



Klemen Gradishar and Prince Abdul Aziz, Minister of Sport PHOTOS: PERSONAL ARCHIVES



In one of the lectures to the home coaches



He also listened to Jose Mourinho.



Klemen Gradishar has been operating in Saudi Arabia for over a year. PHOTO: C.GAVELLE / PSG


There is probably no country in this beloved world where the industrious and resourceful Slovenian soul would not serve the bricks. Even in Saudi Arabia, some of our people have found their business opportunity. Among them is 35-year-old Klemen Gradišar from Naklo, who has been running the football academy of the famous French giant PSG for over a year! It started in the Gorenjska region. “I started writing sports quickly, I was four years old when I started at NK Naklo, where my whole family worked. I like to remember the golden days of NK Naklo when we were the most football village in Slovenia near Beltinci. I played there, was a picker and then played for Sava, Sencur, but I quickly finished my playing career and started coaching. At first in NK Naklo, then for seven years at SAK Klagenfurt, I was also at NK Šenčur, as an external associate at NK Triglav, ”he says about his footballing beginnings.
Last month, outstanding coach Jose Mourinho was at this end of the world, and he was pleased to hear from Klemen.
They did not forget about the CV


In one of the lectures to the home coaches

In the meantime, he met Primorac Sandi Sejdinovsky, who headed the PSG Academy in Egypt. He mentioned to Klemen several times that he would stop working in Egypt and send him his CV. It was said, done, but they did not answer from Egypt. “Then a call came from Saudi Arabia, where he owns a license for PSG's Egyptian Academy. This one knew people from the academy in Egypt where they recommended me. They asked me if I would come to Jeddah and start working, ”Gradishar reveals, who did not ask twice. Today, the 35-year-old Gorenjec is the technical director of the PSG Academy, and his compatriot Narsej Mubi, also a Slovenian trainer, took care of the field work. "First of all, thank you Sandi for helping me, thank you also to my colleague Narse for the work done at PSG. I can always rely on him, he has done an outstanding job. We have worked together through difficult times as well, ”praised the associates, with whom they arranged and established the conditions for the work and development of the College at this end of the world by the Red Sea. Klemen quickly got used to the weather (expected by high temperatures and humidity, warming to 33 degrees today), other cultures and customs. It is clear to him that he prays five times a day there, then everything stops, in the first place there is a prayer.35 cents for gasoline. All Saudi Arabian branches have fast food multinationals; prices are comparable to Slovenian ones, only a liter of gasoline costs about 35 cents.
Land of opportunity
He was set up with a large spacious apartment overlooking the Red Sea. He had a neat ride, he sat behind the wheel himself. “As many peoples are in the city, there are so many different rules and interpretations. With such traffic on four lanes, one becomes accustomed to patience. The practice here is that in the case of a slight collision, abrasion or a dent of the driver, they just swing and go their own way, "Klemen says, saying that Saudi Arabia also opens up to tourists, highlighting the coral reefs in the north of the Red Sea. “Saudi Arabia is a land of opportunity. For Slovenia and Slovenes as well, ”said Klemen, who, in addition to running the academy, takes care of the training and education of coaches. “Football is the number one sport in the country. I am convinced that in the next few years, with the activation of all remaining resources, they will also play an important role in major competitions, "he is convinced.
